data.title: Harry Turtledove Vernor Vinge Eric
data.meta_description: Analog Science Fact & Fiction September 1986 (Sep. Sept.) by Harry Turtledove; Vernor Vinge; Eric Vinicoff; James R. Powell & Charles Pelligrino; Shelley Frier; Elizabeth Moon; Robert C. Murray; Arthur C. Clarke and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Soft cover. Condition: Near Fine. Light wear. Edited by Stanley Schmidt. Cover art by Bob Walters for "The Barbarian Princess" (novelette) by Vernor Vinge. Includes "Though the Heavens Fall" (novella) by Harry Turtledove; "Haiku for an Asteroid Scout" (novelette) by Eric Vinicoff; "Plagiartech" by Shelley Frier; "Sweet Dreams, Sweet Nothings" by Elizabeth Moon; "The Immortal Smyth" by Robert C. Murray. Science Fact: "Making Star Trek Real" by James R. Powell & Charles Pelligrino. Special Feature: "The Steam-Powered Word Processor" by Arthur C. Clarke. Illustrated by Bob Walters, Hank Jankus, William R. Warren.

Soft cover. Condition: Near Fine. Light wear. Edited by Stanley Schmidt. Cover art by Bob Walters for "The Barbarian Princess" (novelette) by Vernor Vinge. Includes "Though the Heavens Fall" (novella) by Harry Turtledove; "Haiku for an Asteroid Scout" (novelette) by Eric Vinicoff; "Plagiartech" by Shelley Frier; "Sweet Dreams, Sweet Nothings" by Elizabeth Moon; "The Immortal Smyth" by Robert C. Murray. Science Fact: "Making Star Trek Real" by James R. Powell & Charles Pelligrino. Special Feature: "The Steam-Powered Word Processor" by Arthur C. Clarke. Illustrated by Bob Walters, Hank Jankus, William R. Warren.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. Cover and spine are good with only mild shelf/rub wear. No dog-eared corners. Solid Binding. All pages intact and legible. Good reading copy. Clean. No store stamps. --- Sep, 1986 issue. --- Science Fiction stories including authors: --- Harry Turtledove --- Vernor Vinge --- Eric Vinicoff --- Shelley Frier --- Elizabeth Moon --- Robert C. Murray.

SingleIssueMagazine. Condition: Very Good. Vol. CVI, No. 9. Edited by Stanley Schmidt. Cover art by Bob Walters for "The Barbarian Princess" (novelette) by Vernor Vinge. Includes "Though the Heavens Fall" (novella) by Harry Turtledove; "Haiku for an Asteroid Scout" (novelette) by Eric Vinicoff; "Plagiartech" by Shelley Frier; "Sweet Dreams, Sweet Nothings" by Elizabeth Moon; "The Immortal Smyth" by Robert C. Murray. Science Fact: "Making Star Trek Real" by James R. Powell & Charles Pelligrino. Special Feature: "The Steam-Powered Word Processor" by Arthur C. Clarke. Illustrated by Bob Walters, Hank Jankus, William R. Warren, and others. Bent from pooor stcking; creasing; edge bumps and nicks with wear.

SingleIssueMagazine. Condition: Very Good+. Vol. CVI, No. 9. Edited by Stanley Schmidt. Cover art by Bob Walters for "The Barbarian Princess" (novelette) by Vernor Vinge. Includes "Though the Heavens Fall" (novella) by Harry Turtledove; "Haiku for an Asteroid Scout" (novelette) by Eric Vinicoff; "Plagiartech" by Shelley Frier; "Sweet Dreams, Sweet Nothings" by Elizabeth Moon; "The Immortal Smyth" by Robert C. Murray. Science Fact: "Making Star Trek Real" by James R. Powell & Charles Pelligrino. Special Feature: "The Steam-Powered Word Processor" by Arthur C. Clarke. Illustrated by Bob Walters, Hank Jankus, William R. Warren, and others. Corner creases.

SingleIssueMagazine. Condition: Very Good+ to Near Fine. Vol. CVI, No. 9. Edited by Stanley Schmidt. Cover art by Bob Walters for "The Barbarian Princess" (novelette) by Vernor Vinge. Includes "Though the Heavens Fall" (novella) by Harry Turtledove; "Haiku for an Asteroid Scout" (novelette) by Eric Vinicoff; "Plagiartech" by Shelley Frier; "Sweet Dreams, Sweet Nothings" by Elizabeth Moon; "The Immortal Smyth" by Robert C. Murray. Science Fact: "Making Star Trek Real" by James R. Powell & Charles Pelligrino. Special Feature: "The Steam-Powered Word Processor" by Arthur C. Clarke. Illustrated by Bob Walters, Hank Jankus, William R. Warren, and others. Minor creasing; mild tanning; corner wear; short rear cover scratch.
